multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have spreading eczema on my trunk and arms, and recently a wound on my left hand started looking infected. There are also more areas of raw, oozing skin developing.
How long have you had eczema, and are there any new products or changes in your environment recently?
I have had eczema since I was younger, and there have been no new products or changes in my environment recently.
Have you started any new medications or treatments for your eczema or any other condition recently?
No, I have not started any new medications or treatments recently.
Do you have a history of allergies or asthma in your family?
I don't have the specific information about my family's medical history regarding allergies or asthma.
Are the infected areas spreading rapidly or associated with fever or intense pain?
The infected areas are spreading, but I have not experienced any fever or intense pain.
Have you noticed any blisters or pus formation in the infected areas on your hand or other affected areas?
Yes, there are crusted vesicles and ulcerations on my left arm.
Final Diagnosis: Eczema Herpeticum.
